website_summaries.verdict: Dual uses let this travel potty perform double duty. An excellent choice if you want something for use at home or on the road.
pros: Works as both a travel potty and a potty seat
Folds down small enough to fit in a backpack
Comes with 3 liners, but they will need to be purchased separately after that
cons: Legs need to be snapped in place before use
Liners can sometimes take too long to get on

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little potty!
customer_reviews.text: This little potty is unbelievable! We are in the car a lot and out running around and we use it on EVERY outing! We've taken it camping, boating, and just general errand running (store parking lots!). She's comfortable in it and likes it better than the "indoor potty". Clean up is EASY as the bags completely cover the potty and seal extremely well when you tie them. I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Travel

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient for toddler
customer_reviews.text: Love this for my toddler. Instead of him having to go to the nasty public bathroom I can let him use this in the car. He is totally potty trained with #1 so this helps when he has to do #2 when were out and about. Love how you can use any bag! I dont see the point in buying the bags it comes with. We use grocery bags and I cut up puppy pads in squares to use to put in the bag to absorb. It's worked great and the puppy pads last a long time I've only bought one pack which was super cheap and haven't had to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to potty train my daughter about 6 years ago and it worked very well. We later used it for travel and trips out in public. It's very comfortable to sit on and you can use it absolutely anywhere. But these bags....the bags are AMAZING! They absolutely hid the odor. Once (TMI), my daughter had to go on the train and I really did not want to have her use the train's public bathroom. She squatted between seats; no one knew what was happening, and you coudln't smell ANYTHING. I think I may actually re-buy these for those car trips and cookouts over the summer break.
customer_reviews.author: A. Troutman

customer_reviews.title: Must have item for the potty training
customer_reviews.text: I was very worried to leave my house without a potty for my daughter, but now, l am as free as l can be. Thank u very much. Wonderful product
customer_reviews.author: Brit in the USA

customer_reviews.title: Essential for long car trips with kids
customer_reviews.text: Life saver when going on long car trips with my 3 kids. Perfect to catch vomit because it sits right on the lap. Can use as an emergency toilet when stuck in traffic. I also use it as a trash can when we have to eat in the car.
customer_reviews.author: snarkysnail

customer_reviews.title: Not stable or safe
customer_reviews.text: Just opened this today & used it once as a reducer on our toilet. It did not seem too stable & when my son leaned far forward, it slipped out from under him & he fell head first to the floor. This has never happened with our usual reducer. Also, the spash guard barely exists. I'm sure it will do nothing to block pee. I bought this so my 18 month old could pee on toilets outside of the house. I hope it magically fits better on them. Hopefully I'll be able to come back and change my review, but things are not looking good at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kiya R

customer_reviews.title: super handy
customer_reviews.text: I try to never leave home without this. It's handy for emergencies when there's no bathroom around, great for travel. I use it as a seat for the LO in public restrooms hotel rooms. The folding feature can be tricky but if it pops off completely i can always snap it back in. I don't think it's sturdy enough for daily potty training. I find it better for accident prevention with kids who are already using the potty. The disposable inserts also work well.
customer_reviews.author: msnewshoes

customer_reviews.title: Buy now!
customer_reviews.text: LOOK NO FURTHER. BUY NOW. This small but mighty potty saved us on each and every road trip. Had it for 3 years and had to leave a review after yet another save. My children are about 55lbs and 40 lbs now and we still use it. At that weight you want to make sure the legs are straight when they sit or have the children adjust by not putting their full weight on it. But don't let that deter you. This absolutely beats going into gas stations or finding a restaurant while on an interstate. We don't pull off without it. This is a love thing.
customer_reviews.author: Tai

customer_reviews.title: Okay but there are better ones
customer_reviews.text: We bought a few different potty options for my daughter, for travel we got both this potty and the OXO travel potty and the OXO is way better. This potty chair the legs you have to pull out and push into place, then to re fold them you have to really pull on the chair, if there's any pee on it you're getting messy and it's just not easy. Functional, but not as good as the OXO which clicks into place and a little button releases it SO much easier.
customer_reviews.author: PATRICK DAHNERT

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool for Toddler/ Baby while traveling
customer_reviews.text: We took our 18 month old on a 2 week trip to Europe with this potty and 8 cloth diapers. We hand-washed the diapers in the sink and air dried, and everything else was flushed down, thanks to this ingenius potty. It folds out for the big potty, and folds with legs so you can potty baby in a field. I originally had the white and gray potty, and it blended in so well I left it and never got it back, so I bought the lavender and green one for our trip.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Matadobra

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A LIFE SAVER AND GAME CHANGER
customer_reviews.text: This you guys this.... LIFE SAVER!I just use the liners and stick it in my mini van and my little ones can potty ANYWHERE in privacy. Toddlers literally touch every surface in a bathroom (DISGUSTING) and this prevents that. We also no longer have to find privacy on the side of the road during road trips. It is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: aanks

customer_reviews.title: Mom paradise
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I'd be happier a product like this existed! Oh my! Best travel buddy. I pop it anywhere we need to, no issues. I love how its super close to the ground so it gives my little one a lot of comfort. The second stage, where you can completely open it and set it on top of a toilet, is awesome because you can "jam" the flaps in lock, so they don't randomly collapse. I can fit and tiny shopping bag on this potty, don't need the actual bag that are recommended, though those are nice too! Super easy to clean, to carry, and it comes with a fitting carry bad which i love because its super discreet.
customer_reviews.author: ah903

customer_reviews.title: GENIUS
customer_reviews.text: I admittedly have never owned a tiny potty like this for my other kids because I thought it would be silly. OMG THIS IS THE BEST THING EVER. Traveling? Throw it in the car. Home? Kid can carry it anywhere. Run into the gross gas station bathroom? It pops open and you plop it onto the seat. How did I potty train a kid before this?! It comes with disposable bags but I just purchased the silicon insert. So easy to clean. My 2 year old does it herself! I may have to buy a second one, just because.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany P.

customer_reviews.title: Great portable training potty!
customer_reviews.text: What a great portable potty! We are still in the process of potty training and this is an invaluable tool! I love how it can easily transport (even comes with a bag to carry it in) and how the potty bags have an absorbent bottom to them. Makes for easier clean up on the go! The potty legs also flatten out do you are able to place it on a toilet if you are out (I also love to use the disposable potty shields ... Sold seperately) The cons: Only comes with a few disposable bags (more are available for purchase) and it is a little short for my tall trainee. Other than that, awesome product and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: This has saved us several times.
customer_reviews.text: This potty and the disposable liners will ALWAYS be in my car. We first used it during a two day road trip. My daughter was newly potty trained and she used it several times when a bathroom was not available (even when we were stuck on the side of the road waiting for road-side assistance). We have used it several other times as well. I never worry about a bathroom at a park not being available, because I know we can just pull this out of the car if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy R

customer_reviews.title: folds up and folds out
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and the silicone insert to have a travel potty to help train our 2 year old. We also ended up just using it around the house. It was great for travel as the legs fold inward. It also is great for just sticking in a backpack when out and about to use on public toilets. The legs fold out as well and you place this on top of the public seat and is secure for my toddler to sit on. We found this product so useful we bought a 2nd one to have handy.
customer_reviews.author: kbl

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: For the win. Love this thing. I thought when it arrived that it was going to be too small, but my 2.5YO loves it. He calls it his green potty! Love that you can use it as a stand alone, or in a public rest room. Also good for facilitating #2 as it is low to the ground and is more like his pre-potty-training position of choice..ha ha ha!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Burghardt

customer_reviews.title: Good for travel, difficult for boys
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is portable and they sell the disposable and reusable liners. It's mostly great, the only problem is my son pees out the front of it almost every time. Even if we point things down and close his legs it still finds a way out. This doesn't happen with our Baby Bjorn potty. Makes a big mess at least 50% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have for newly potty trained kids
customer_reviews.text: This has saved us from using filthy and stinky public toilets. My newly potty-trained daughter used this when we go to parks or festivals where there are no bathrooms. I can't imagine having to go into a porta potty with her and having to endure the cramped space and the stench while I wait for her to go. I've done it on the plane with her, but I don't have a choice there. It also works on top of a regular toilet seat so this goes with me wherever I go now.
customer_reviews.author: kayni

customer_reviews.title: A DREAM for parents with little kids
customer_reviews.text: How did parents ever survive without this? Especially when you have multiple kids and there’s no way you are going to take everyone out of the car by yourself because one kiddo as to go potty Right Now. There have been times when we’ve been on long trips or during pregnancy that this has helped the parents, too! The price for the refill bags is entirely reasonable considering 1) the tsunamis our kids have unleashed in these 2) we’ve NEVER had a leaky bag even when we had to leave it in the car until our next stop (or we forgot about it and it was still there, intact, the next day!)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for on-the-go pottying!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great potty to have. I generally leave it in the car and we call it the "car potty." It's SUPER useful when going to the playground or park. Sometimes there are no bathrooms available or there are gross portable ones. This potty makes the whole ordeal easy. A quick pee before we hit the park and a quick pee before we head home and we're set. This has also been wonderful for camping. My 2-year-old has had no issue using this potty.
customer_reviews.author: S. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Legs are too short.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a daycare provider for many years and one difficult situation is when one child (girl usually) needs to go to the bathroom. Taking the whole crew inside is a drag or cleaning out a potty outside isn’t always ideal. I was very excited about this product until I introduced it to the children. This is a great idea and made very well but the legs are too short so the kids don’t feel comfortable using it.
customer_reviews.author: Shar

customer_reviews.title: Road trip hero
customer_reviews.text: This product was amazing on our last road trip! We didn’t have to take our kids into any nasty gas station bathrooms or “scary” rest area vault toilets. We set up the potty right outside one of their car doors on the Pavement of rest stops or on side roads in the rural areas, and we used a pop up windshield shade as a privacy screen. Boy age 6 and girl age 4. We now keep it in the car for when we go hiking or biking, all the park restrooms are closed due to Covid. I’ve even carried it in my hiking daypack! The bags are worth the price too
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase for potty training
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for traveling with a toddler that its potty training. While on long drives there has been a couple of occasions that my 3.5 year old had to go potty. So instead of rolling the dice to see if she will hold it until the next rest stop, we were able to pull over to the side of the road and use the potty trainer seat in the car or even outside depending on the weather (which is nice to prevent a smelly car when she needs to do a #2) This thing is a must for parents!
customer_reviews.author: lotusflowerbomb

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, and fits every toilet we've tried it on
customer_reviews.text: It's compact, sturdy, and fits every toilet we've tried it on. We keep it in the diaper bag for vacation, trips to the park, and everything in between. I wish the legs snapped out of standing position a little more easily, but I have no complaints about anything else! Regular plastic shopping bags fit inside--I cut a diaper in half to absorb the pee--but the proprietary bags are better quality. Take your pick. We also have the reusable liner, which has its own pros and cons. This isn't our everyday, in the house potty, but it's very good for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Library Chick

customer_reviews.title: I really love this as a travel potty and I use the ...
customer_reviews.text: I really love this as a travel potty and I use the reusable silicone liner rather than the disposables (I try to be as earth-friendly as possible). The one thing I would change about it is that when using the reusable liner, even with the liner collapsed, there is no way to attach the liner to the potty or to clip it on or something so that they can travel as a unit. Other than that, I absolutely love this potty and my almost 15 month old uses it just fine when we have long trips at the park/on long car rides/etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Yoder

customer_reviews.title: A great travel potty!
customer_reviews.text: This travel potty saved me on a recent trip to Fl...a mere 2 weeks after my son began to master saying those words we all eventually want to hear from our toddlers “I have to go potty.” The thought of setting him on the airport..or hotel toilet made me cringe. This travel potty was a constant companion in the diaper bag and was easy to set up. My son adjusted to it quickly! The plastic drawstring bag it comes in is a little flimsy..but otherwise I’m pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Our little guy is 19 months and petite... and this is way too small for him. On the floor, he can't squat over it comfortably because it's too low to the ground. As an insert for the toilet, it's unstable. Moreover, the legs don't work well, alternating between collapsing and getting stuck. We're trying to build his confidence and independence, not turn potty training into a balancing act.
customer_reviews.author: Nixipixi

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Great for short-trips about town. I have a bit of a reluctant potty-trainer in the form of a stubborn 3-year-old boy. But this thing I love. Still small enough to fit in a diaper bag (which I still carry for toys, drinks, snacks, etc.) when we are out and about. I have a skinny little guy, so this is a life-saver in the public restrooms where he would (a) fall in and (b) ew...not on my baby's butt please. 2 thumbs up here. I only didn't give it 5 stars because the little humps in the middle are a bit high. But certainly not enough to prevent from buying again.
customer_reviews.author: V. Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: Keep some wipes in handy for wipedown.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I can't stand seeing my son hold on the sides of a public toilet's seat. So far, it's been working great! I haven't used the bags yet but I'm sure it'll come in handy during long car rides. May have some backsplash because it's a smaller so do keep some disinfectant wipes close or rinse it when you get home.
customer_reviews.author: Mabel Leong

customer_reviews.title: I would totally recommend the liner by the same brand as it does ...
customer_reviews.text: I always dreaded "mommy I need to poop, RIGHT NOW". not anymore with this potette plus. We had a long trip across the country and quite a few times I stopped over to the side of the road or some parking lot somewhere to let my young boys relieve themselves. I would totally recommend the liner by the same brand as it does not stink or leak. I mean we could always save a few pennies by using plastic shopping bags but it doesn't quite work out the same way. I don't plan to make my minivan a permanent portapotty so I don't mind investing in truly functional liners for real emergency situations. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Phan

customer_reviews.title: Must have for potty training, compact, not bulky and extremely convenient!
customer_reviews.text: A-mazing! So compact and usable in all scenarios. Love that it fits in my backpack, car, or stroller and is not bulky or inconvenient. Has saved us many potty accidents so far, he just pops in it in the car and we're good to go. Definity would buy the bags that come with it, makes it so nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer VanGenderen

customer_reviews.title: Collapses easily
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed, potty collapses so easily. It's such a great concept but having the potty collapse on my daughter is not good. Legs need to be more substantial and really lock in place.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: We used this to successfully potty train our 26mo girl
customer_reviews.text: We used this with the silicone cover to potty trained our little girl. It was convenient to start on the ground and then move it over to the toilet later once she got the hang of it. Now that she is familiar with it, we can take it out easily wherever we travel. I did end up buying another potty that was more convenient for everyday use (had handles and covered more of the toilet seat) but we still use this for travel. Ended up buying a 2nd one during potty training just to have one upstairs and now to keep in the car for when we go out.
customer_reviews.author: Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT for travel! Took to hotels so he didn’t “fall in” the big toilets, used while staying at other’s homes for same reason. GREAT for camping and keeping the little potty set up in the tent for poops so we didn’t have to hike forever to a yucky bathroom. A few saves on road trips too - pull over for a quick set up in the back! Overall a great thing to have on hand for early potty training. Not one leak from those bags either!
customer_reviews.author: Lorie Delk

customer_reviews.title: Good travel 2 in 1 potty seat
customer_reviews.text: This potty is great for travel and easy to use. Pros: Toddler can use it on the floor or it can be used on a public toilet seat. Comes we only 2 bags so make sure to order extra bags. Cons: if you have a 2.5 yo that is as tall as a 4 yo this seat will be too short/small for them. I didn’t realize how small this seat was. Ended up having to buy something else for him because I have a tall boy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love this product we leave it set up in our ...
customer_reviews.text: We love this product we leave it set up in our car since our little one has a fear of public restrooms it is also great for those long car rides that don't always have access to a potty for your little one. Also like how it can be used as a seat for a "big potty". I recommend this to anyone who has a little one they are trying to potty train who might have a fear of the public restroom or wants to avoid an accident in the car because there is no close rest stop.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: I loved having this while we were first potty training our ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved having this while we were first potty training our son, for use in public restrooms. I also liked the fact that if we were out somewhere park, camping etc.. where we didn't have access to a restroom, it could fold into a little potty. We never used the bags that you can purchase separately to use with it. I think if you wanted to use any old plastic bag like a target/walmart bag that you could easily make that work.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer - A must by for toddlers potty training
customer_reviews.text: Game changer. I've had this since I potty trained my 2 year old a month ago and it is a game changer for being able to leave the house. We use it daily, mostly in the back of our car. Make sure to buy the liners! This thing is a life saver. Note that it is really tiny so my 99% percentile 2 year old (35 lbs and super tall) is able to use it but barely in terms of size but he fits and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. very convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I've seen this suggested many times but finally broke down and ordered one for travel. It came in handy on our most recent trip. When the bathroom was available, I could use it as the seat adaptor. When the bathroom was occupied I could set it up as a potty. It's pretty low to the ground. My son is 10 months (average size) and could stand up easily when finished. It folds up nicely and comes with a little carry bag for east transport.
customer_reviews.author: dmc

customer_reviews.title: a great traveling necessity
customer_reviews.text: we have used this potty on so many trips or emergency stops. The bags that come with it are easy to put on, legs are easy to click in or pull out for storage. It came the most handy with potty training and then on the beach/ camping with no facilities. It fits almost any bag or backpack and came in a little bag with a string. A great buy
customer_reviews.author: Petra Holt

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I use this a lot more than I thought I would! My daughter was scared of the big loud potty in stores. This helped ease her into using public potties. She felt more secure and it only took a handful of times using it to make her comfortable. However, I continued to use it because I felt better having her put her hands down on this instead of the nasty public seat. I kept a travel pack of disinfectant wipes in the travel bag and wiped it down each time. Now it stays in the trunk for roadside emergencies. We have used it at parks with no restrooms and once or twice on the side of the road.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Boullie

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use...
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these years ago for my son. On the go they're awesome! I remember taking my 1 year old to a car show, when he said "dad.. I gotta pee" set up in the back of my truck... took care of business right there... easy and done... Just remember to toss the bag out of the back of your truck... haha! Bought a couple more of these for friends that had children recently....
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Love this potty seat
customer_reviews.text: Love this potty seat. We mostly use it when we are out and about, it’s nice having a potty seat for the car when we are on road trips. My only complaint is because the seat is so small it’s easy for you child to miss and get pee everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing so much! Perfect size for the little toosh (used at 18mo when first potty trained and now still at almost a year), easy to use outside or on toilets. Plop our child on the seat and don't have to worry about falling in or holding or nothing...it's such a big aid.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Works great but wrong color received
customer_reviews.text: Bought the red and blue one while back. I had intended it to be used as a toilet cover but it saved us a handful of times on road trips as a standalone potty when we didn't feel comfortable stopping to use the restroom during the COVID pandemic. The first couple of times my son tried it, he fell over before going. I hadn't clicked the legs into place. D'oh! Since then everything's been just fine. I ordered the green and blue one for my car so we wouldn't have to keep track of it but received the mint and white one. I'm not returning it because it will do the job but it's not what I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: ANdrew

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best purchases I've ever done. This little thing saved us from many embarrassing situations with our 3 year old daughter. It comes in handy when you're on a trip or a highway and there are no toilets around. The small bags that comes with it are highly absorbent and soak up everything pretty quickly. Overall it is very easy to use, takes almost no space at all, and is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Yousef

customer_reviews.title: Portable potty but doesn’t fit on a regular toilet! Bummer
customer_reviews.text: It’s a portable potty that folds conviniently. However, it doesn’t fit on a regular potty (too small and wobbly) We have a different brand trainer seat which is sturdy and fits well. Will be returning to purchase a second one from the same brand.
customer_reviews.author: Good job

customer_reviews.title: Great little potty seat!
customer_reviews.text: Love this potty seat SO much! It has been awesome in potty training my daughter. Would highly recommend! I haven't found a big potty that this didn't fit on top of and it is smaller than any other potty seat I've seen and very sturdy. We've not needed to use it as a potty just a seat so I can't speak to how it works in that capacity but it would be very low to the floor/ground.
customer_reviews.author: KAL

customer_reviews.title: It does the job of providing an intermediate between butt and disgusting toilet: ) but of course it is not ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for my child starting at around 14 months. It does the job of providing an intermediate between butt and disgusting toilet :) but of course it is not perfect, the child's feet and hands can still end up touching the toilet. I am not even trying with the potty legs bent and used as a potty by itself because I do not trust that it will not "unbend" under the weight of the child. Fits in my Fjallraven Kanken bag I use as a diaper bag.
customer_reviews.author: Karolyn

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It is the perfect travel potty. Stays in the back of my car and i can use it on its 2 legs with a bag, or fold the legs to the side and it can sit on a potty at the hotel or grandma's house. I do not by the bags. They are too pricey for what they are. I use plastic grocery bags and buy the bed chucks at the dollar tree. You can cut one chuck up into 6 squares and put them in a bag...works just as well!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny265

customer_reviews.title: Great for potty training and for on the road
customer_reviews.text: Our child is afraid of public bathrooms so we take this potty with us every time we go out and even put it in our child’s room at night (on a puppy pad just in case) in the event of an emergency at night. It is a must have when potty training.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Compact, lightweight and necessary!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver! Since Covid has closed most public bathrooms, we needed an on the go solution, and this is it! It pops open in a matter of seconds and your toddler is ready to go. The legs also fold out to work as a kid sized seat for full sized toilets. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: NLN

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean up is simple.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! This portable potty is so easy to use. At first I was hesitant on buying it because I figured I could get away with a small toilet seat cover, but we've already used it twice while out at the park. When out at a restaurant or shopping, this fits on every toilet I've used and my daughter just hops right on and does her business. It's also helpful to use while training so when you are out, your child is already familiar with this seat so there's no additional fear of going pee away from home. The bags make clean up so simple. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Arie

customer_reviews.title: No pinches, great for travel
customer_reviews.text: This is great for keeping in the car for potty training and beyond. It is pretty compact and comes in handy for outings where the toilet seat is too big. Other potty seats have seams that fold in the seat surface- which can pinch skin and be traumatic for the little one. This one does not. That should be enough reason to get it. It's nice to have the option of the bag that fits the seat as well. Have not had to use that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: This has worked great for us!
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great for us! This is a great portable potty seat for children learning how to potty on a toilet and is also something that's easy to bring along when you're out and about. You can easily place this on a public toilet so that your child sits on something clean. You can hook plastic grocery bags to it and let them use it if there is no place to potty. I usually line the bag with a couple paper towels to ensure that it doesn't leak out when they're done.
customer_reviews.author: H.Le

customer_reviews.title: Great for even the largest children!
customer_reviews.text: After much research, I'm glad I purchased this potty seat for my 3yo super tall 40lb daughter. I read so many reviews about the child feeling unstable, but this one definitely makes her feel secure while we're out and about. We just started potty training a few weeks ago and she's used this a handful of times. It fits inside my little crossbody diaper bag. I can't imagine having to use the travel potty aspect, but I'll keep it in my car just in case. Would definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for on the go instead of public potties
customer_reviews.text: So happy I purchased this!!! Potty training was going really well but my daughter is afraid of the big public toilets that flush automatically. I didn't want to be set back when we went on a trip to Disney and this worked great! She had no trouble using this and wanted to try it as soon as we opened the package at home! I used grocery bags with this a couple of times and it worked fine but the ones they sell are most convenient. Also the video shows a reusable liner but mine did not come with that.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Maybe better for girls, not great for boys
customer_reviews.text: It’s small enough and easy to carry in the diaper bag. But with my son, his pee goes all over the inside rim of the seat and splashes back on him or through to space between the seat and the lid. I have to aim him directly down for it to not spray. He seems to fit fine on it and the seat sits in an obvious spot on the toilet so I think maybe this is better for girls instead.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great travel toilet
customer_reviews.text: Such a convenient on the go emergency toilet for my toddler. I don't think it fots on top of a toilet well. You would need to take their pants and undies off. And on the road or in a public bathroom, I'm not trying to undress and dress a toddler. As a stand alone toilet for emergency, it's been a lofe saver!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa S.

customer_reviews.title: I received it and expected to be using it but my daughter conquered her fear and was blessed with excellent bladder control so i
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to be honest here: I bought this for my 3 year old who was afraid of loud flushing public toilets. I received it and expected to be using it but my daughter conquered her fear and was blessed with excellent bladder control so it sat in the back of my car unused for months- until this week. My daughter caught a 24 hour stomach bug and didn't want to leave the bed, even to vomit. Broke the Potette plus out and used it like a fancy barf bag/bowl. Much easier than a bucket. Minimal clean up. My daughter seemed to feel more comfortable using this in place of a bucket, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A.

customer_reviews.title: Just ok. Love the liners but not the travel potty as much
customer_reviews.text: I only have my son use this potty as a standalone and not an attachment to a regular toilet. It works fine if you're in a pinch, but my son usually sits to potty and he has to bend forward quite a bit to make sure the urine stays within the potty. Also it is quite low and wobbly if not clicked into place properly. My son has "fallen" into the potty a few times because I did not click it all the way down, in my hurry. Also, it's not really that easy to carry around. Unless you have a huge diaper bag, you will still need to carry it around separately.
customer_reviews.author: dk555

customer_reviews.title: carawysong@yahoo.com
customer_reviews.text: This little toilet is a parents dream. No more worrying if you can find a bathroom or not. Since I started pottty training kids, we have had one of these toilets on the go. I first found out I needed one, when I took my kids to park that didnt have a toilet.
customer_reviews.author: The Healthy Family

customer_reviews.title: Thanks to Jeff Lewis for recommendation!
customer_reviews.text: Heard about this on Jeff Lewis Live, and figured we would try it for our newly potty trained daughter. Worked great on our boat outing when she had to go. Thanks to Jeff for recommending this product! Our friends are getting one as well, now!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for the car.
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 kids(11,6,4&1y). I bought this for baseball/softball games and practices, when we are not close to a bathroom(ors it’s too busy for littles to wait). I can pop this open in the floorboard of the car and the younger three can do their business, completely covered on all sides whether they need to go #1 or #2.
customer_reviews.author: Momx3Top Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: This helped to complete potty training
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent! The second to last step for our potty training wad public restrooms and this did the trick. I buy toilet seat covers and set this seat on one of those so my daughter's feet don't touch the toilet. But she is able to sit on the big potty without getting gross. This is small enough to fit in a med size wet bag (which I used for clothe diapering). In the front pocket I have my toilet seat covers and clorox wipes. Big pocket, this toilet. Seriously this has made going in public easier.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy potty seat!
customer_reviews.text: This seat is great! Super sturdy and I love that it can be used as a stand alone potty or as a toddler seat for an adult toilet. I had been carrying a regular toddler potty in my car and in a bag to the playground, on walks, etc, so this is so much more compact! I bought the bags that go with it and they don't leak at all. The legs are a little stiff to pull in and out of the locked position, but I suppose this makes it even more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: cf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for on-the-go
customer_reviews.text: This has been perfect to keep in our on-the-go bag and works great on regular toilets to help 2-year-old sit by herself without falling in. Didn't think we'd really use the trial of "bags" included, but they've turned out to be great, and we'll probably order more to have in the car! Very pleased with how this works.
customer_reviews.author: shawn arnold

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! It's going to make travel and camping so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Butler Family

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: This was very useful for my three-year-old, who loved using it. Such a life saver camping and in the back of the car when we're out and about! I was hoping my bigger kid could also use it, but at 30 pounds my youngest seemed to be about the limit of what this small potty seat can hold.
customer_reviews.author: J. N. Horn

customer_reviews.title: Great for Home or on the Go!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Potette Plus as a travel potty for my 18 month old son. It is so convenient on the go. You can either use it flat on top of a normal toilet or as a mini potty with a plastic bag to catch the pee/poop. My son has grown to love this more than our normal "home" potty for him (a Summer Infant potty), so we've started using it at home too! I think the low-to-the-ground profile makes it more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: AmberTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Must buy when potty training!!!
customer_reviews.text: This seat cover is so needed!! You have a potty training child BUY IT!!! You can use it anywhere, it folds down and it can sit up as a potty itself if you need to. My friend used it in the back of her car with her son when there was no potty anywhere around. and it was so simple you attach a bag and bam you have a toilet!! We have used it on the side of the road when a little girl just couldn't hold it!!! And it fits perfect on any toilet since the flap fit out ultra wide. Plus it has a pee guard for little boys!! Its such an amazing seat!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Johannes

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping or hiking
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 3 and 4.5 year old when we're out camping or hiking. The seat with the plastic carrying bag it comes with fits and a couple liners fit in our backpack along with all of our other necessities and it doesn't pack on too much weight. It's definitely not the most comfortable looking seat but it gets the job done if you need something portable.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Must have while traveling.
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this to take with us on our trip to Maui since we would be doing lots of beach, hiking and road trips. This is a life changer, our 2-1/2 year daughter who is potty trained made a good use of it. Didn't have to stop and use the bathroom at any store. I must say you have to order the bags separately because it doesn't come with it. Our trip was so smooth thanks to this potty travel toilet
customer_reviews.author: Jensen Mamaril

customer_reviews.title: If it was a little taller it'd be more comfortable for my tall 3 year old to use
customer_reviews.text: Got this for at the beach where there is no bathroom close by for the little ones. It works perfectly the only downside is that it's really really really low to the ground. If it was a little taller it'd be more comfortable for my tall 3 year old to use. But it does the job and the bags that go with it are great. No leaks and it soaks up the liquid well.
customer_reviews.author: Jb2023

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I've used this potty exactly 3 times, but I was SOOOO happy to have it ALL 3 times! I had to set this up 3 times at 2 different malls. After asking my toddler (2.5 years) if she had to go potty before leaving the mall and having her say 'no', we had to set up this potty in the parking lot by our car. She's quite tall for her age, and she still fit on this potty. Get the potty - and the refills - for stress-free travel. And put a new liner in immediately after you dispose of the used one so you're never caught off-guard.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for 4yr old
customer_reviews.text: This product is a lifesaver. My 4yr old will pee and poop anywhere thanks to this gem of a product. She is still hesitant on big and loud toilets and this provides consistency that is key with her still wanting to go when she needs to. We have used at the zoo, at Nana's house, in the trunk of the car. I use the disposable bags (which I don't love for a environmental factor they aren't better than diapers) and we have the reusable insert for at home. I also love that I can wash it up and pass it along to another family when we are done because it is so easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: This is a sturdy product that is great for all toilets and children
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy product that is great for all toilets and children. The two ends stretch to the length of each side of the toilet. It will stay in place if the child is placed on the potty correct or the child does it by themselves. My son had no issues using the toilet with this product. It made the potty training easier for us by taking away the fear of the toilet seat being to big for him.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Giraldo

customer_reviews.title: Not what was pictured!
customer_reviews.text: This is not about the product, but more about seller and what you see. The picture shows purple and pink. The reason I chose that one is because purple is my daughter's favorite color. Anyone knows with potty training, little things like that can really help to encourage. Unfortunately I recieved white and baby pink....NOT WHAT WAS PICTURED! What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Colon

customer_reviews.title: BEST PORTABLE POTTY!
customer_reviews.text: WEL LOVE THIS PORTABLE POTTY! We loved it so much we bought TWO! We keep one in the car and put one in the house so when we walk to restaurants or go for a short walk, we put it in our bag. This potty is simple, it works with or without a toilet. It has legs for it to become a small potty or can be leg-less to sit on an adult toilet. It is so compact and it works! My son can use this potty anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good and Toddler likes Colors
customer_reviews.text: The product is as described in other reviews. The ring itself seems a bit light to put onto a toilet seat, but it works. My daughter loves the color making it easy for her to use. I would have liked it to be sturdier. I also bought the OXO Tot one that seems to be sturdier. I like that the OXO has a button to control how far back the stand goes. I haven't used it long enough to really know how it will do at a restaurant or while we're out and about though.
customer_reviews.author: Evowindo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for toddler
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy my friend recommended this to me. I planned to keep it in my car but we also use it on our regular toilet seat. My toddler gets much more excited about using it as opposed to the small toddler potty she has. Great purchase and so easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: ASenter

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but quality and design makes it really irritating to use
customer_reviews.text: Annoying. Once you have snapped the sides into place to get an upright potty, it is virtually impossible to pull them to release (to fold back flat) without pulling them off. It's just a basic problem with the quality and size of the mechanism (plastic pieces). And my toddler hates it anyway. When they sit on the seat, they're sitting on a plastic bag, and that seems to freak her out. Ok, she's a toddler, but I wish it were designed so the bag fits under / around the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Helena

customer_reviews.title: Best Potty Seat Out There!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the greatest potty seat. It has silicone grippy stuff on the bottom so when you put it on a toilet it doesn't slide around. This is key for a squirmy toddler. It also is a FANTASTIC travel potty. We take it everywhere - using it standalone with the bag insert and as an adapter. Perfect for long road trips!
customer_reviews.author: Cait L

customer_reviews.title: Easier potty for on the go.
customer_reviews.text: This potty is the best for on the go potty training. We use it in the back of our van and in public restrooms. So much easier and secure for my 2 year old. I carry some small bleach wipes and wipe the feet off after touching public bathroom floors before packing up. We love it so much this is our 2nd one we ordered. I have even used it in a pinch while camping.
customer_reviews.author: F. Williams-Brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect potty for on-the-go
customer_reviews.text: This potty is compact, but sturdy. It easily fits in my backpack with room to spare. My daughter likes it and will even use it in the car (this has saved us multiple times). I also bought the reusable insert, which fits in the same bag as the Potette. This saves me a ton from not having to buy the disposable bags.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. We have had it about a month and this thing has saved me and my wife about 6 times already! We have an SUV and it's perfect for you to pull over and have your child do their business right there IN the car. The only thing we did and would recommend, instead of spending money on the bags that go with this thing, go and buy small trash can bags. They are cheaper and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, however we never used it
customer_reviews.text: I know friends who swore by having this on hand during potty training and with newly potty trained children. However, ours hasn't gotten even one use. The product works great, is small and convenient to have on hand. We just haven't found a time to use it and our child has been potty trained for almost one year. I hope I get some use out of it with our second child.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Love it and must have
customer_reviews.text: We just use this toilet seat to travel from Ohio to California and then Hawaii and back. We had four total flights all of which were close to five hours each.We had four total flights all of which were close to five hours each. my 2 1/2-year-old loved putting the party on the seats that she could not usually sit on and made for no accidents during the trip. It fits perfectly into a typical backpack and we just cleaned it off with Lysol wipes. I highly recommend this for anyone who has a toddler who is either potty training or already potty trained and simply cannot sit on the big toilets.
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color sent, very short and difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: I was sent the wrong color. It is very low to the ground and no pee guard for boys. Hard to get to click into place. Probably will keep this in our 2nd car for those just in case moment but I will be getting something different.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Nowell

customer_reviews.title: A Portable Potty for Travel and Home use
customer_reviews.text: We actually have two of these now. One moves around the house the other goes with us on travel in car and airplanes. Right sized for laying over round and oblong toilet seats so tot doesn't have to fear falling in. Prop it on ground on side of road for the times when there'no restroom in sight on a long desolate highway...lots of colors to pick from to make a boy or girl happy and encouraged to go at home and on the go. Easy to open and fold closed. Thumbs up for ease of use and ease of cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: ABQMomma

customer_reviews.title: Not the throne toddler was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: All 3 of my kids use this potty, but it is flawed. I bought it to train my 2 year old boy. It's not easy to undo the stationary position. The legs pop all the way off. It also slides on the toilet. He hates that. The plastic is uber hard, which makes him uncomfortable when he's on it a while. My 6 year old girls love it for emergencies, but probably because it makes them feel like toddlers again.
customer_reviews.author: TM Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This potty seat is absolutely amazing. Perfect for carrying around in the diaper bag. Absolutely wonderful for traveling. This is definitely a must have if your in the go a lot
customer_reviews.author: Zurama

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT! 100%
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! One of the best purchases I have made recently. This is great for potty training to have in the car but also in the days of Coronavirus its awesome that my kid doesn't have to use a public rest room.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi P.

customer_reviews.title: If you have a toddler you need this!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a toddler/young child you definitely need one of these! I have been out with my kids so many times at parks that don’t have bathrooms and this has been a life saver!!! This is so easy to set up and clean up. Perfect size for small children. Small enough to throw in the bottom of the stroller or in your car.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: This is the best potty. I’ve tried several different ones
customer_reviews.text: This is the best potty. I’ve tried several different ones, but this works as a seat and a standalone potty! Would highly recommend. Compact so easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this travel potty! I'm commutting alot and when I started potty training my daughter I knew I needed something for the road. The only bad thing is I wish it sat just a little higher, but other than that I've used it countless times.
customer_reviews.author: StephAA

customer_reviews.title: Worth it’s weight in gold!
customer_reviews.text: My little 2 y/o is potty training & is afraid of the bigger public toilets. I can sit this one on the floor if needed (with toilet paper under the feet) and she will use it. Also great for when she has to go and we’re in the car, in the middle of nowhere or camping.
customer_reviews.author: Cristal B.

customer_reviews.title: Great! Must have!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this potty!! We have used it at several restaurant bathrooms successfully the last week or so. The liners haven't leaked at all. We haven't used it on top of a larger toilet yet. I love that this is clean, so I don't have to worry about dirty toilet seats. I wipe off the legs and bottoms of the legs with antibacterial wipe after my daughter uses it, then put it back in the plastic bag it came with, then into my diaper bag. LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mallita

customer_reviews.title: Works great and best way to feel comfortable with toddler using ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great and best way to feel comfortable with toddler using the potty while out and about. The bag they give you is not very useful (think glorified hotel dry cleaning bag), but it fits in any small bag folded up. They only thing to remember is to look at the instructions prior to use. I did not realize the legs had to lock and the first time it was used, toddler and myself were surprised when the toilet collapsed ...oops. Still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Myers

product_meta.title: Kalencom Potette Plus 2-in-1 Travel Potty Trainer Seat Red
feature_bullets: Comes with 3 super absorbent, leak-proof and easy-to-use disposable liners
Suitable for ages 15 months and up to 50lbs when used as a traveling potty
Easily converts to a folding trainer seat. Contoured seat for your child's comfort
Non-slip, durable, and comfortable. Can be used on all toilet seats
Legs lock into place when opened

specifications.Material Type: BPA Free, Phthalate Free, Latex Free, Lead Free
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,406 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
